meanings.definition: A loud, sharp cry or shout.
meanings.sent1: The yow of the baby woke up the entire house.
meanings.sent2: I heard a yow coming from the forest, probably an animal in distress.
meanings.sent3: The yow of the cat when it saw a cucumber behind it was hilarious.
meanings.sent4: The yow of the wind through the trees sounded like a ghostly wail.
meanings.sent5: The yow of the thunder made the storm even more frightening.

meanings.definition: Used to express pain or surprise.
meanings.sent3: Yow, I almost dropped my ice cream cone!
meanings.sent4: The sudden loud noise made me yow in surprise.
meanings.sent5: Yow, that roller coaster was thrilling!

meanings.sent1: The yow grazed peacefully in the meadow.
meanings.sent2: The shepherd counted his yow before sunset.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous dog chased the yow around the barn.
meanings.sent4: The yow's wool was soft and warm.
meanings.sent5: The yow's gentle eyes looked at the shepherd with trust.
